oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Consolidated monthly report for Provost Marshal's Department for District of Georgia
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Georgia -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Military police
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Monthly report of the Confederate Provost Marshal of the Georgia District providing numbers of officers and privates for each division in his district and statistics for individuals charged with offenses. Categories include drunkenness (officers and privates), stragglers forwarded to the front, Federal troops received, and civilians charged with treason.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Provost Marshal's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Military provosts command the military police force of a designated area.
